entry.title: Packing instruction and determination by using reference material - Public Cloud WM
entry.content:
Hi,
I am setting up packing instruction using reference material. According to documentation, the you need to :
1. Create reference material (in my example ref-pallet1) (VERP) which is maintained on products (WMTG12) which are packed same way as reference material. On material WMTG12 reference mat.for packing is maintained.

 

2. Then packing instruction is created for reference materials ref-pallet1. Row is marked with R.

3. Determination is maintained for 0IBD Inbound delivery

If I now test to pack in WM inbound delivery, it does not create HU automatically. 

If I maintain the determination for WMTG12 by using same packing instruction -> then system is able to pack according to instruction. Is this how it is supposed to work? I understood from SAP documentation that the determination would be maintained only for reference material?

entry.title: delivery block at credit management in Cloud ERP
entry.content:
In ERP, delivery Block can be performed using credit management.

Can Cloud ERP delivery Block due to credit management?

In SSCUI 102137, "A", "B", and "C" cannot be selected for "credit check"

"D":auto credit management only

But In SSCUI:101707, I can set credit limit checks for each delivery type.

entry.title: Issue with Sending Email Notifications for PO Approval Workflow in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
I created a PO approval workflow and it works fine.
The client then requested email notifications for three cases:

  • PO approved

  • PO rejected

  • PO on hold

I configured Email Templates, the Notifications section in the workflow, and assigned the notifications to the relevant roles/users.
However, no emails are being sent.

Is there any additional configuration needed in CBC, or any prerequisite activation before workflow email notifications can work?

Any advice would be helpful.

entry.title: Credit Memo on Asset Triggers ‚ÄúNegative Acquisition Value‚Äù Error- Explanation requested
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I‚Äôd like to share an update regarding an issue I previously raised. When posting a credit memo on an asset in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the system triggers error messages about negative acquisition values‚Äîeven for very small amounts (e.g., 1 euro).

 

Context:

  • The asset is still in the first year of its useful life. (5years)

  • The asset class is ZMAT.

Temporary Solution Applied: Following community advice, we enabled the ‚ÄúNegative values allowed‚Äù option temporarily in the asset master data. This allowed us to successfully post the credit memo.

My Question:

Could you please help me understand the business rationale behind this behavior and the implications of applying this workaround? I am aware that enabling ‚ÄúNegative values allowed‚Äù is generally recommended for Assets under Construction (AuC), but does the same recommendation apply to fixed assets as well? In other words, is this workaround considered a best practice by SAP, or should we explore alternative configurations to prevent potential issues in reporting, compliance, or asset management in the future?

 

Thank you in advance for your insights!

FIN Asset Accounting  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Asset Management  SAP ERP

entry.title: Facing issues during Depreciation posting in SAP Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Community,

We are facing an issue during the depreciation run where the system displays the error: ‚ÄúAccount assignment not available.‚Äù When we attempt to update the account assignment, another error appears: ‚ÄúPlease change account assignment objects in new time intervals.‚Äù

We understand this error occurs when postings already exist. Upon checking, we found that depreciation has been posted under Depreciation Area 15 for November with Journal Entry G000003452, but there are no postings under other depreciation areas.

Could you please guide us on:

Where is this G-series journal entry posted? and this entry cannot be reversed
How can we proceed to post depreciation for Depreciation Areas 01 and 34 for November?

Thank you for your support.

Thanks
Naveen Kumar

entry.title: Different list of entries in app settings for manage planned orders (F4170)
entry.content:
Dear community,

there are a few users in department with the same set of roles, except the key user with some additional roles. When they open the app manage planned orders (F4170) they can change the area of responsibility (AOR) in the personal settings. The options look like this:

Now there is a new user with a recently created user account with the same set of roles. He will get a different list of options in the MRP settings, asking for AoR and usage of app F0251A:

What is causing this different list of options? I did not find any hint in the roles and restrictions how to modify the content of the app settings.

Thank you.

Regards,

Dirk

entry.title: Is it possible to get journal entry async API confirmation in single payload?
entry.content:
Hi,

I am using below API to create all the required journal entries through single payload. This i am doing by splitting the node (JournalEntryCreateRequest) with number of journal entry needed.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b978f98fc5884ff2aeb10c8fdeb8a43b/22a267e571e948499fda007a65b27c64.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=2508.500&q=TAX+ACCOUNT

But, when the confirmation is getting generated it is sending separate confirmation payload by journal entry created rather than single payload with information of all journal entries created.

 

This was not the case before. can you please help in letting me know where would be the issue?

Thanks & regards

entry.title: Archiving Custom Database Tables in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I'm currently working on a data archiving in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and I have a few Questions about the Archiving of Custom Database tables.

For SAP standard tables, the process is well-defined and handled via the Information Lifecycle Management (ILM) framework, using standard ILM and archiving objects.

My challenge is with custom-developed database tables. I want to archive data from these tables, but I'm struggling to get the ILM framework to recognize my custom setup.

Here's what I've done so far:

  • I created a custom ILM Object and a corresponding Archiving Object for my custom DB table.

  • However, when I try to configure this ILM Object in the relevant ILM settings, I cannot assign the custom ILM Object to an Audit Area.

This leads to my main questions:

Is the ILM Framework fully supported and suitable for custom-developed tables and data archiving in SAP Public Cloud?

If yes, where can i configure the missing settings, so that the ILM Framework recognizes my ILM Object?

If ILM is not the recommended path for custom tables, what are the alternatives for archiving?

I'm considering the use of the Document Management Service (DMS) 

  1. Is DMS a viable storage for archived structured data?

  2. If so, would the data need to be converted into a specific document format (like XML or JSON) before being stored.

  3. Are there any best practices or recommended services/APIs in the Public Cloud specifically designed for archiving custom, structured business data outside of the standard ILM flow?

Any insights from someone who has successfully implemented archiving for custom solutions in the SAP Public Cloud would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: The G/L accounts are not displayed in the Manage Global Hierarchies app.
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

 

When attempting to add a G/L Account to a G/L Account Hierarchy in the G/L Account Node there are no G/L Accounts displayed from the value search. 
It is not possible to add general ledger accounts to a hierarchy as they are missing in the "F4" search. 

 

Best regards,

entry.title: Romania VAT300
entry.content:
Romania VAT300 declaration for Public Cloud Edition

Dear all,

In Romania there was a legal change in the VAT  regulation. One of the mandatory reports is VAT300 declaration. 

I have seen that there was a Hotfix in Oct on 31.10.2025 including also this topic: https://me.sap.com/notes/3630491/E.

But in the tax box structures  definition I was not able to find the following lines included in the declaration: 9.1, 24.1 and 25.1.

I could not find an additional information in the OSS notes. It seems that the stucture is not the latest one.

Can anyone generate successfully the D300 declaration in Public Cloud for Romania, save it and validate the generated report with ANAF? If yes, I would kindly ask for your guidance.

Thank you.

Kind Regards

entry.title: Budget EAC/ ETC for entreprise projects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

As part of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition  project, I would like to present the identified open points, the investigations carried out, and the potential solutions I have considered. I would also like to know if there are standard alternatives to address these needs

Identified Issues

  • Unavailability of EAC* (Estimate at Completion) and ETC* (Estimate to Complete) functionalities for enterprise projects in SAP Cloud Public
  • Finding a solution to manually enter the initial budget budget without using the CSV file (scope item 1H

Investigation and Proposed Solutions

For the first point (EAC/ETC):

  • Excel: Export budget data from SAP Public Cloud and calculate EAC and ETC using formulas.
  • Custom CDS Views: Create custom views to extract the necessary data (committed costs, remaining costs) and perform calculations outside SAP.
  • SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC): Build dashboards incorporating EAC and ETC calculations.
  • Adding specific fields: Create two new data points (EAC and ETC) in reporting, which would require custom development.
  • Implementing service projects: Considered as an option, but raises integration issues with production and logistics.

For the second point (initial budget):

  • We have only found the solution via CSV upload.

Questions

Are there standard functionalities or recommended best practices in SAP Public Cloud to:

  • Calculate and display EAC and ETC in enterprise projects?
  • Enter the initial budget manually without using the CSV file?

Thanks

entry.title: Issue with Withholding Tax Codes Not Appearing in DRC Configure Value Mapping ‚Äì Colombia Localizatio
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Colombia localization), including Document and Report Compliance (DRC) for electronic invoicing with the DIAN.

The communication channel with the tax authority is working correctly ‚Äî invoices are successfully sent and return with an Approved status.

However, we are facing an issue specifically in the Configure Value Mapping area.

üîç Issue Summary

In the Configure Value Mapping app, only the VAT Tax Codes (e.g., codes starting with A* or V* for sales and purchasing VAT) are visible and available for mapping to the Tax Code ID required by the DIAN.

But the withholding tax codes configured in our system do not appear in the Value Mapping list.

These include:

  • RETE-IVA

  • RETE-ICA

  • ICA

  • Self-withholding (Autorretecci√≥n) types

  • Other withholding tax codes configured internally (our customer uses codes starting with 8*)

These withholding tax codes are correctly configured in the system, work in the accounting simulations, and are already being used in multiple test scenarios.
However, they do not show up in the Configure Value Mapping app, which prevents us from linking them to the Tax Code IDs specified by the tax authority.

üìÑ Impact

When generating the electronic invoice PDF, all fields related to withholding taxes appear empty.

Since the withholding tax codes cannot be mapped (because they do not appear in the Value Mapping catalog), the DRC processing does not include them in the XML/PDF output.

‚ùì Question for the SAP Community

Where in CBC or within the Document and Report Compliance configuration should Colombia withholding tax codes be mapped so that they appear in Configure Value Mapping?

Is there an additional configuration step or specific prerequisite for withholding tax codes to appear as eligible values in the mapping catalog?
Currently, only VAT tax codes are being recognized by the system as ‚ÄúTax Code ID‚Äù candidates.

We would appreciate guidance on:

  • Whether Colombia withholding tax codes are expected to appear in Value Mapping

  • If they must be created or exposed through a different configuration artifact

  • Whether any CBC configuration node must be enabled for withholding tax mapping

  • Or if withholding taxes are not supported for mapping in the current DRC scope for Colombia

We will attach screenshots showing where VAT codes are visible, and where withholding tax codes (8*) do not appear.

Thank you in advance for your help and insights.
